ai.summary: A gentle 5.2 km circuit at Attingham Park in the UK, suitable for families and casual walkers. The route follows flat parkland and woodland paths with minimal elevation gain, offering a relaxed and scenic outing.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly wide gravel and tarmac paths through parkland and woodland. Expect gentle slopes in places and some grassy sections; footing is generally good, but trails can be muddy after rain.
ai.safety_notes: Wear sturdy footwear and weather-appropriate clothing. Stay on marked paths, keep children and pets under control, and be mindful of other visitors and bikes on shared routes. Bring water, a map or GPS, and a phone with emergency numbers saved. Check park opening hours and plan for changes in weather; tell someone your planned route if walking alone.
ai.best_seasons: Spring, summer, and autumn for comfortable temperatures and scenic surroundings; the route is achievable year-round but can be less pleasant in deep winter or after heavy rain.

seo.title: Mile Walk at Attingham Park – Easy 5.2 km Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the Mile Walk at Attingham Park: a gentle 5.2 km hike in the UK suitable for families. Learn about terrain, safety, best seasons, and essential gear.
